titleStmt.title: J. Pock et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4165

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky:

The undersigned Citizens of Dover Mason County and its vicinity, would respectfully represent that Samuel S True, in the year 1859, being a grocer, obtained license from the town of Dover to sell spiritous liquours, (said Town being authorized by an act of the Legislature so to do) and believing the whole power of licensing to sell liquor was vested in the trustees of sd town. He omitted to pay the usual county tax requred in such cases, and was indicted therefor in the Mason Circuit Court at the Spring Term 1859 and fined the sum of Sixty dollars and costs. Your Peitioners, believing that said True was entirely ignorant that he was committing any violation of the state law, and that he regarded his license from the Trustees of Dover as full authority for vending spiritous liquors would respectfully and ernestly petition your Excellency to remit said fine.

Respectfully
J. Pock
Ethan Anderson
M M Jennings
Marcus Anderson
P N Jennings
M Smith
Willias D Lee
Thos A Ressess
Thos P. Anderson
Rob Y. Evans
Jas McMillian
W F Thomas
Arthur F. Dobyns
A Rasses
Thos A Carran
Wm A Chalfont
J. C. Mitchell
Jas H Anderson
Leonard C Anderson
Jas McDonald
O Sulinar
J. M. Thomas
A. D. Veach
Charles Sadenburger
W E Tabb
P. C. Bullock
John L. Tabb
Jas. F. Lee
Peter S Anderson
A. F. Dobyns Jr
Moses Moore
F Adams
J C Hess (Police Judge of Dover)
John Magilll
Jared Drak
Thomas Mooran
The facts as set forth in the above petition are to my knowledge true, and furnish a case deserving the Executive interposition

Mason Cir Court
vs
S. S. True
Respited for 6 months
3d Oct 1863
